  16. (* Copy a bytecode executable, removing debugging information and possibly
  17.    dynlink information and #! header from the copy.
  18. *)

  20. open Misc

  22. ‌let remove_header = ref false
  23. ‌let remove_DBUG = ref true
  24. ‌let remove_CRCS = ref false

  26. ‌let remove_section (s : Bytesections.Name.t) =
  27.   match s with
  28.   | DBUG -> !remove_DBUG
  29.   | CRCS -> !remove_CRCS
  30.   | _ -> false

  32. ‌let stripdebug infile outfile =
  33.   let ic = open_in_bin infile in
  34.   let toc = Bytesections.read_toc ic in
  35.   let oc =
  36.     open_out_gen [Open_wronly; Open_creat; Open_trunc; Open_binary] 0o777
  37.                  outfile in
  38.   if not !remove_header then begin
  39.     (* Copy header up to first section *)
  40.     seek_in ic 0;
  41.     let header_length = Bytesections.pos_first_section toc in
  42.     copy_file_chunk ic oc header_length
  43.   end;
  44.   (* Copy each section except DBUG and CRCS *)
  45.   let toc_writer = Bytesections.init_record oc in
  46.   List.iter
  47.     (fun {Bytesections.name; pos; len} ->
  48.        if not (remove_section name) then begin
  49.          seek_in ic pos;
  50.          copy_file_chunk ic oc len;
  51.          Bytesections.record toc_writer name
  52.        end
  53.     )
  54.     (Bytesections.all toc);
  55.   (* Rewrite the toc and trailer *)
  56.   Bytesections.write_toc_and_trailer toc_writer;
  57.   (* Done *)
  58.   close_in ic;
  59.   close_out oc

  61. ‌let options = [
  62.   "-remove-header", Arg.Set remove_header,
  63.      "remove the header that calls ocamlrun automatically";
  64.   "-keep-header", Arg.Clear remove_header,
  65.      "preserve the header that calls ocamlrun automatically (default)";
  66.   "-remove-debug", Arg.Set remove_DBUG,
  67.      "remove all debugging information (default)";
  68.   "-keep-debug", Arg.Clear remove_DBUG,
  69.      "preserve all debugging information";
  70.   "-remove-dynlink", Arg.Set remove_CRCS,
  71.      "remove the data needed for dynamic code loading";
  72.   "-keep-dynlink", Arg.Clear remove_CRCS,
  73.      "preserve the data needed for dynamic code loading (default)";
  74.   "-all", Arg.Unit (fun () -> remove_header := true; remove_DBUG := true;
  75.                               remove_CRCS := true),
  76.      "remove header, debugging info, and dynamic code loading info"
  77. ]

  79. let usage =
  80. "Usage: stripdebug [options] <input file> <output file>\n\
  81. Options are:"

  83. let main() =
  84.   let anon = ref [] in
  85.   Arg.parse options (fun x -> anon := x :: !anon) usage;
  86.   match !anon with
  87.   | [output; input] -> stripdebug input output
  88.   | _ -> Arg.usage options usage; exit 2

  90. let _ = main()
